address: THE METROPOLIS, 9 NORTH BUONA VISTA DRIVE 138588
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Introduction

Connected Freight is a technology startup funded and incubated by Shell Ventures; one of the first corporate venture funds to focus on reducing emissions. Connected Freight enables a network of retailers, suppliers, and logistics providers to have an integrated process for order, dispatch, and fulfilment of your deliveries. With Connected Freight as your logistics partner, you save time, money, and reduce your carbon footprint. This is accomplished in one secure, transparent, and convenient platform.

Due to our aggressive core growth plans, and  a major shipping provider asking us to digitize one of their lines of business, we are scaling our technology team. This includes the addition of several data scientists.

As a data scientist you are expected to help formulate clear problem definitions, work on proof of concepts to prove the feasibility of the proposed approaches and maintain and improve our current models in production. Additionally, by suggesting and implementing metrics to be tracked you will help us with building out our analytics capabilities. As such, a good foundation in mathematics and statistics is expected. Expect to work on a broad scope of data science related problems, varying from regression to mathematical optimisation, so any experience in such topics is appreciated. However, don’t be deterred, what we value most is willingness to learn and the persistence to work through challenging problems.

Job requirements
A bachelor's or master’s degree and 0-2 years of experience with a good foundation in mathematics and statistics (e.g. business analytics, mathematics, statistics, theoretical sciences, computer science or similar)
Demonstrable knowledge of at least one programming language, and a willingness to learn more. We don’t work in a particular language but expect to interact with Kotlin, TypeScript, Python and some R.
Demonstrable experience in data analysis. Having knowledge of ML concepts and libraries is preferred.
A good foundation in operations research is highly preferred. Familiarity with problems such as scheduling problems, vehicle routing problems, cubing problems and bin-packing problems is appreciated.
Any experience working on problems in the logistics domain is highly valued (e.g. transport, aviation, warehousing, etc.).

job_title: Assistant Vice President, Data Scientist, Data Management Office
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Design analytical solutions/experiments to solve various strategic business problems through engagement and research.
Building and deploying Machine Learning Algorithms, Advanced Analytics, and Data Visualization across the UOB group and region.
Support the Enterprise Data Architecture and Governance Program in developing and transforming the Analytics Capabilities across the group
Partnering with assigned teams and/or business units to provide deep expertise and advisory on data analytics needs
Strong knowledge of data and analytics architecture to ensure analytics objectives are aligned to business priorities on the Data Transformation Program
Drive Innovation initiatives under CDO guidance and directives.
Job Requirements
Min Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data or Computer Science or a related field
Min 4 years analytics working experience in banking / financial services industry is desired
Possess a selection of skills and experience with analytical tools and languages such as R, SAS, python, SQL, Pig and other Hadoop-based languages
Possess the ability to query and use large, robust data sets across traditional Data Warehouse and Hadoop platforms.
An analytical mind and team player to build strong business partnerships
A strong communicator, with clear articulation of analytical findings through presentations. Experience with data visualization packages will be a plus
Innovative and Agile thinking – experience with Test and Learn Frameworks desirable

Roles & Responsibilities
• Skilled in microstrategy and powerbi dashboarding
• Can write ETL or leverage Alteryx to manipulate data
Manages entire track, including but not limited to team management, stakeholder management, hands on delivery
Required to speak Mandarin due to China stakeholders
• Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
• Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc .
• Great communication skills
• Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
• Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, • Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
• Good scripting and programming skills
• Data-oriented personality

Roles & Responsibilities
Areas of responsibility
1 - Data analysis: Support key APAC business processes with advanced analytics
Identify what data is needed, available and relevant to the problem
Design and develop strategic methods for data collection and analysis
Integrate and prepare datasets; build and evaluate data models
Explore and analyze data using advanced scientific methods, including but not limited to machine learning and predictive analytics, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, information retrieval, image recognition, graph analysis, network simulation & optimization, process automation, geospatial analysis, statistical and mathematical programming, application prototyping
Summarize and present findings and recommendations to business users and stakeholders in understandable and relevant ways, both verbally and visually
Document and publish analyses so that others may reproduce and learn from prior work
2 – Project support: Support key APAC business strategies with analytics solutions
Provide analytical and subject matter expertise for the development of analytics solutions needed to support main business strategies and initiatives
Work with peers in Business Intelligence, Data Management and Data Analytics to develop and provide solutions
Build plans; ensure work progress; identify and report success measures
Prepare and present progress reports and outcomes to stakeholders
To be successful in this role, you will need:
Education: Master’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or similar discipline.
Experience: 2 years practical, advanced analytics experience in any industry (4 years for Senior)
Expert analytical skills; statistical and mathematical knowledge; modeling and visualization skills
The number one data analytics ability: to constantly and independently ask questions, find answers, and learn
A good understanding of fundamental business principles and problems
Professional skills: planning & organizing. Project management certification is a plus.
Fluency in written and spoken English

Roles & Responsibilities
As the Insights Manager you’ll help the consumer and marketing teams to understand the user even better. Your expertise and contributions will help them improve existing and continue building user-focused products that improve their lives. Your role will provide invaluable insights about what motivates the consumers, why they behave the way they do and their sentiment towards products, brands and communications.

You’re a data-driven storyteller! You don’t just stop at numbers and graphs but are able to translate numbers into actionable business insights and recommendations. You’re able to captivate a range of stakeholders from various disciples to bring about positive shifts in the way the brand interacts with users, creators and public media. Through your expertise, you’re able to navigate the client through noise to land on impactful results.

Ideally, you have covered projects for public relations, policies, brand reputation and marketing influencing the changing perceptions of users. You’re expected to have exceptional content presentation skills as you capture the audiences.

Role:
You’re a data storyteller by heart and able to translate insights into actionable business recommendations through compelling user stories and market dynamics.
You will work on projects covering highly regarded tech products in the market as you help to identify, translate and present the voice of the users through in-depth analysis and by deep diving into usage data.
You are a research enthusiast and a progressive, insightful and a natural fan of all things tech and marrying that with your passion for market research, insights, data analysis and science.
Beyond data and insights, you’re expected to help formulate brand, product, communications, language, creative and messaging suggestions, objectives and strategies.
You will help the wider insights, research and product marketing teams to better understand product usage and behaviors, brand’s health and reputation, as well as media impact and effectiveness.
You:
BA/BS/MA/MSc degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years experience as a Research Manager, Insights Manager, Data Analyst or Data Scientist; ideally on technology client projects.
Ideally, you have experience with: Python, R, SQL, QlikSense, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
Significant experience in insights, data analytics and data science (client or agency-side), e.g. quantitative survey execution (questionnaire design/development, sampling/weighting, cross-tabulation), qualitative (co-creation, ethnography, group discussions, workshops) and marketing effectiveness.
Ability to work effectively cross-functionally and to make data and insights accessible and easily digestible to a non-expert audience.
Experience designing and supporting research projects to gain actionable business insights; directly or alongside creative agencies.
Experience liaising with third-party research agencies and complex, multi-country research studies.
A self-starter and independent thinker who is able to craft meaningful stories, insights and suggestions based on data.
Driven by an entrepreneurial environment, eager to take advantage of new technologies and data sources to create new and interesting ways to understand users.
Demonstrated technical expertise and knowledge of tech products and offerings.
Exceptional analytical, project and stakeholder management and presentation skills.
Exceptional verbal and written English communications skills and, ideally, fluent in another Asian language to support with projects spanning across APAC.

Please note: due to the high volume of applications, only successful candidates will be contacted with a follow up introduction email. If you do not receive an email from Maker Lab, your application has been unsuccessful this time around. Look out for future roles!

Roles & Responsibilities
Exposure to Latest Technologies
Great Working Environment
About Our Client
Our client is a leading financial service organisation with strong presence across APAC. They are looking to hire a Data Scientist.
Job Description
As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for the following:
Implementing various machine learning techniques for various security related projects.
Helping the internal teams on performance improvements and creating algorithms.
Working on large sets of data and participating in data exploration activities to make sure proper data usage is done.
Being a subject matter expertise in deep learning techniques.
Working with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, understand business processes and conduct data cleansing to enable data visualisation to technical stakeholders
Supporting the Group IT & Data Governance Guidelines.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful candidate you will have a bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience within the data management and analytics space. You will have experience in azure analytics platform, Hadoop, machine learning, R and Python along with good understanding of ETL tools. You will also have experience in building up data platform and projects. Prior experience in Agile & Scrum Project Management will be good to have.
What's on Offer
Great Working Environment
Excellent Salary Package

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a seasoned Senior Data Scientist to accelerate the growth of Amazon Prime through data analytics. Our vision is for Prime to be the Earth’s largest and most loved membership program. We look forward to partnering with you to advance our innovation on customers’ behalf.

As a senior science thought leader, you will build ground-breaking, state-of-the-art causal inference models to guide multi-million-dollar investment decisions. You will architect and execute a research roadmap that connects science, business, and engineering and contributes to Amazon Prime’s long term success. As an independent contributor, you mentor and nurture junior scientists on the team to set them up for success.

The ideal candidate will be an established expert in data science, especially in the area of causal inference. You are comfortable leading through ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. You think big on the next game-changing opportunity but also dive deep into every detail that matters. You insist on the highest standards and are consistent in delivering results.

Primary Responsibilities:
- Own a multi-year research roadmap that guides Prime’s investment decisions.
- Work with Product, Finance, Economist, and Data Engineering teams across the globe to deliver data-driven insights and products for regional and world-wide launches.
- Innovate on how Prime can leverage data analytics to grow faster.
- Contribute to building a strong data science community in Amazon Asia.

job_title: Senior Associate, Data Scientist, Operations Intelligence - Data Science, SG Consumer Banking Operations, Technology & Operations (WD22066)
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Operations Intelligence (OI) under SG Consumer Banking Operations (SG CBO), enables Operations to make data-driven decisions for proactive management of service, productivity, and risk.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams/stakeholders to identify opportunities, gather requirements and prioritize actionable insights through application of Machine Learning (ML) /Deep Learning (DL) Models to solve complex problems for proactive management of service, productivity, and risk
Responsible for full AI/ML model life cycle management, industrialisation and operationalisation including data gathering, development, model training, deployment, monitoring and performance optimization using ADA platform and tools
Develop the Data Driven Operating Model (DDOM) Control Tower and subsequently, Machine Learning (ML) /Deep Learning (DL) Models for Cards and Unsecured Loan Servicing or any DDOM Initiatives that SG CBO is involved
Closely partner stakeholders to design experiments, perform data iterations and present/share the results of the data with relevant stakeholders (e.g. Management, squad members) in an easily digestible format.
Provide analytics support for different purposes such as managing digital exceptions during production issues, improving productivity and mitigating risks
Good Business knowledge in ‘connecting the dots’ from the data to solving business problems using, but not limited to, classification, regression, clustering and deep learning algorithms
Ability to understand the business operations as a whole and translate questions into effective analysis
Innovate to deal with data imperfections; data munging and using algorithms to efficiently organize large data sets.
Design and build automated reporting dashboards on our data visualization platforms
Education & Experience
Minimally University degree in mathematics, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, computing or related quantitative discipline with a strong background in statistical concepts and calculations
At least 6 years of experience in model development, validation and testing, deployment and model performance monitoring
Good understanding of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine learning approaches, NLP concepts and deep learning
Strong programming and modelling skills in the following:
Python, Pyspark, Spark SQL, MySQL
Hadoop eco-system (Hive, HDFS, Pig etc.)
Data engineering pipeline experience including real time data computation
End to end data science workflow experience, starting from data extraction, wrangling, modelling and deployment in production environment
Deep and practical understanding on implementing high performance, well-behaved analytics applications; data ingestion, feature engineering, model selection, training, validating and deployment
Experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis
Familiar with the use of Qlikview/ Tableau for both development and insights reporting
Business Knowledge or prior experience in the consumer banking area would be advantageous
Core Competencies
Strong combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity, and with a strong appetite for challenges
Highly adaptable with big data technologies, able to pick up new methods and techniques quickly and apply towards solving a problem at hand
Comfortable working in a fast paced, hypothesis driven, collaborative, and iterative engineering environment
Comfortable deconstructing complex/open-ended problems which may not yield a clear-cut solution
Meticulous and structured individual with good time management to oversee/ manage or prioritize multiple deliverables
Integrity and maturity to manage the sensitivity of data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good team player with the ability to work collaboratively as part of a squad while maintaining the ability to work independently in carrying out tasks to completion aligned to original goals with minimal supervision
Requirements (Nice to have)
Experience on Cloud computing platform
Experience on Data Science Workbench (Cloudera, AWS)
Exposure to McKinsey’s problem solving techniques, analytics translator
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client is looking for a highly accomplished talent to take up the position within the team, this will gear up for our next phase of hyper growth. Mark your CV with another successful achievement with this company.

Together with the team, you will:
Feature engineering on financial market data, blockchain data and market trends
Research on cryptocurrency market data with purpose of detecting trading behaviour anomaly and market patterns
Develop risk management system for the exchange by identifying the leading factors of market movements and measuring the impact of market fluctuations
What are we searching for?
Experience in machine learning application in finance market data, preferably in pattern recognition, anomaly detection
Familiarity with unsupervised algorithms
Proficiency in Python/C++/Java/R, and working with databases like SQL/ElasticSearch
Exposure to algorithm trading and knowledge of market microstructure is a plus
Familiarity with AWS and Linux is a plus
Ability to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment
To fasten the process, please send your CV to chi.pham@masonac.com & jobs@masonac.com

Mason & Co
2 Kallang Ave, CT Hub, #09-10, Singapore 339407
